title: Common English Vocabulary Words that Start with V

json.text: Welcome to PnT English channel. A learning English vocabulary with videos channel.
Welcome to the oxford 3000 essential words program. Now, let's start learning English!
Section 22: Words Starting with V. vacation v . a . c . a . t . i . o . n . vacation.
vacation means leisure time away from work devoted to rest or pleasure. We get two weeks
of vacation every summer. valid v . a . l . i . d . valid. valid means
well grounded in logic or truth or having legal force. They put forward many valid reasons
for not exporting. valley v . a . l . l . e . y . valley. valley
means a long depression in the surface of the land that usually contains a river. He
looked down at the valley below. valuable v . a . l . u . a . b . l . e . valuable.
valuable means having great material or monetary value especially for use or exchange. Another
human being equally valuable in the sight of God.
value v . a . l . u . e . value. value means a numerical quantity measured or assigned
or computed. The value assigned was 16 milliseconds. van v . a . n . van. van means a small or
medium-sized road vehicle with one row of seats at the front and a space for carrying
goods behind. The mechanic said that the brakes on our van need to be replaced.
variation v . a . r . i . a . t . i . o . n . variation. variation means an instance of
change; the rate or magnitude of change. The great variation in water volume in Iran's
rivers poses a major problem for the people living there.
variety v . a . r . i . e . t . y . variety. variety means a collection containing a variety
of sorts of things. He had a variety of disorders. various v . a . r . i . o . u . s . various.
various means of many different kinds purposefully arranged but lacking any uniformity. Various
experiments have failed to disprove the theory. vary v . a . r . y . vary. vary means make
or become different in some particular way, without permanently losing one's or its former
characteristics or essence. Her mood varies in accordance with the weather.
varied v . a . r . i . e . d . varied. varied means characterized by variety. His work is
interesting and varied. vast v . a . s . t . vast. vast means extremely
large. The vast majority of the eggs would be cracked.
vegetable v . e . g . e . t . a . b . l . e . vegetable. vegetable means edible seeds
or roots or stems or leaves or bulbs or tubers or nonsweet fruits of any of numerous herbaceous
plant. I found a big chunk of pork in my vegetable soup.
vehicle v . e . h . i . c . l . e . vehicle. vehicle means a conveyance that transports
people or objects. Maybe some day, people will be able to ride space vehicles to the
moon for a holiday. venture v . e . n . t . u . r . e . venture.
venture means any venturesome undertaking especially one with an uncertain outcome.
The children ventured into the forest to look for bunnies.
version v . e . r . s . i . o . n . version. version means something a little different
from others of the same type. An experimental version of the night fighter.
vertical v . e . r . t . i . c . a . l . vertical. vertical means at right angles to the plane
of the horizon or a base line. The monument consists of two vertical pillars supporting
a horizontal slab. very v . e . r . y . very. very means is used
to give emphasis to a superlative adjective or adverb. He played very well.
via v . i . a . via. via means by way of; by means of; through. To London via Paris.
victim v . i . c . t . i . m . victim. victim means an unfortunate person who suffers from
some adverse circumstance. Not all the victims survived.
victory v . i . c . t . o . r . y . victory. victory means a successful ending of a struggle
or contest. The general always gets credit for his army's victory.
video v . i . d . e . o . video. video means a recording of both the video and audio components
(especially one containing a recording of a movie or television program). They could
still receive the sound but the video was gone.
view v . i . e . w . view. view means a way of regarding situations or topics etc. Consider
what follows from the positivist view. violence v . i . o . l . e . n . c . e . violence.
violence means an act of aggression (as one against a person who resists). He may accomplish
by craft in the long run what he cannot do by violence.
violent v . i . o . l . e . n . t . violent. violent means acting with or marked by or
resulting from great force or energy or emotional intensity. The citizens of our city are increasingly
concerned about the rise in violent crime. violently v . i . o . l . e . n . t . l . y
. violently. violently means in a violent manner. They attacked violently.
virtually v . i . r . t . u . a . l . l . y . virtually. virtually means in essence or
effect but not in fact. The strike virtually paralyzed the city.
virus v . i . r . u . s . virus. virus means ultramicroscopic infectious agent that replicates
itself only within cells of living hosts; many are pathogenic; a piece of nucleic acid
(DNA or RNA) wrapped in a thin coat of protein. Bigotry is a virus that must not be allowed
to spread. visible v . i . s . i . b . l . e . visible.
visible means capable of being seen; or open to easy view. Mountains visible in the distance.
vision v . i . s . i . o . n . vision. vision means the ability to see; the visual faculty.
the perceptual experience of seeing. That's my vision of how the world could be.
visit v . i . s . i . t . visit. visit means go to certain places as for sightseeing. Did
you ever visit Paris? visitor v . i . s . i . t . o . r . visitor.
visitor means someone who visits. The other day we had some visitors from Switzerland.
vital v . i . t . a . l . vital. vital means urgently needed; absolutely necessary. It
is absolutely vital that our computer systems be upgraded.
vocabulary v . o . c . a . b . u . l . a . r . y . vocabulary. vocabulary means a listing
of the words used in some enterprise. His speech is immature, his vocabulary limited.
voice v . o . i . c . e . voice. voice means the distinctive quality or pitch or condition
of a person's speech. A shrill voice sounded behind us.
volume v . o . l . u . m . e . volume. volume means the amount of it that there is. The
sheer volume of traffic and accidents. vote v . o . t . e . vote. vote means a choice
that is made by counting the number of people in favor of each alternative. There were only
17 votes in favor of the motion. Thanks for watching! This is all for section
22: Words starting with V. You can move on to section 23 : Words starting with W. We'll
see you next time. Goodbye!
